intro: Himantoglossum hircinum monstr. johannae, commonly known as the Johannae's spurred orchid, is a rare and specialized orchid species native to specific alpine regions. It belongs to the Orchidaceae family and is characterized by its unique spurred petals and intricate floral structure. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its flowers are usually a mix of white and purple hues, with a distinctive lip that aids in pollination by specific insects. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
